magpie.analytics

Class ClassificationStatistics

  • java.lang.Object
    • magpie.analytics.BaseStatistics
      • magpie.analytics.ClassificationStatistics
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Commandable, Options, Printable, Savable

    public class ClassificationStatistics
extends BaseStatistics

    This class handles the calculation of statistics for classifiers. It implements the "class cutoff" feature described in BaseClassifier.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • applyClassCutoff

        public double[] applyClassCutoff(double[] x,
                        int nclasses)
        Takes a continuous class variable and converts it to discrete values that range between [0,nclass). For an instance in x that ranges between 0 and nclasses-1, the following rule is applied:

        x[i]-floor(x[i]) > cutoff ? ceil(x[i]) : floor(x[i])

        If that value is below 0, it is set to be zero. And, correspondingly, if it is greater than nclasses-1 it is set to nclasses-1. The cutoff is taken from the instance of the ClassificationStatistics.

        Parameters:
        x - Array of continuous class variables to be adjusted
        nclasses - Number of discrete classes known
        Returns:
        Class variables adjusted to exist only on integer values (see above)
